FuncDef:
The shutdown command changes a bridge domain (BD) to the Down state.
The undo shutdown command changes a BD to the Up state.
By default, a BD is in the Up state.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If a BD is faulty and needs to be filtered out, run the shutdown command to change the BD to the Down state.
Configuration Impact
The BD in the Down state does not forward packets. As a result, users within the BD cannot communicate with each other.
Precautions
Traffic on a VBDIF interface includes Layer 2 traffic and Layer 3 traffic. Running the shutdown command in the BD view forbids all traffic on the VBDIF interface, whereas running the shutdown command in the VBDIF view only forbids Layer 3 traffic.
